Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Lets analyze each order Order 1001 Events 1 Register Order 2 Perform Credit Check 3 Validate Stock 4 Confirm Shipment 5 Ship Goods 6 Issue Invoice 7 Receive Payment This follows the normal flow Order 1002 Events 1 Register Order 2 Confirm Shipment Logistics This is step 4 but we havent done step 2 Perform Credit Check or step 3 Validate Stock 3 Ship Goods Logistics step 5 but again missing credit check and stock validation 4 Perform Credit Check Finance step 2 but after shipment 5 Validate Stock Warehouse step 3 after shipment Anomalies Confirm Shipment and Ship Goods occurred before Perform Credit Check and Validate Stock Order 1003 Events 1 Register Order 2 Perform Credit Check 3 Ship Goods step 5 but missing step 3 Validate Stock and step 4 Confirm Shipment 4 Issue Invoice 5 Confirm Shipment step 4 but after shipping late confirmation 6 Receive Payment Anomalies Ship Goods occurs before Confirm Shipment Validate Stock is missing entirely Order 1004 Events 1 Register Order 2 Receive Payment step 7 but very early 3 Issue Invoice step 6 but after payment 4 Confirm Shipment step 4 shipment_scheduled N 5 Ship Goods step 5 without confirming shipment Anomalies Payment received immediately after order registration before invoice Invoice issued after payment Missing Perform Credit Check and Validate Stock Shipment confirmed as not scheduled but then goods shipped

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Summary of anomalies A Order 1002 Shipment confirmed and goods shipped before credit check and stock validation B Order 1003 Goods shipped before shipment confirmation late confirmation Validate Stock activity missing C Order 1004 Payment received before invoice is issued Missing credit check and stock validation Shipment confirmed as not scheduled shipment_scheduled N but then goods were shipped

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Hypotheses For Order 1002 The order was marked as priority and the team tried to expedite by skipping some steps But then they realized they need to do the credit check and stock validation so they did it after shipment This could be a policy violation For Order 1003 The warehouse shipped the goods without having a formal confirmation Or the system allowed shipping without confirmation Then the logistics manager confirmed the shipment later This might be due to a system error or manual intervention The stock validation step was skipped Maybe because the system assumed stock was available Or an error in the process For Order 1004 The customer paid immediately maybe by credit card so the payment was recorded first But then the invoice was generated later This might be due to an asynchronous process Or a system design flaw The credit check and stock validation were skipped Maybe because the payment was received in advance The shipment was confirmed as not scheduled But then shipped This is very odd It might be a data entry error Or the system allowed shipping without scheduling

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Proposed SQL queries to investigate We want to check for deviations from the normal process Lets define the normal process steps in order by activity name 1 Register Order 2 Perform Credit Check 3 Validate Stock 4 Confirm Shipment 5 Ship Goods 6 Issue Invoice 7 Receive Payment Anomaly 1 Missing activities We can list all activities that are expected in the normal flow and check if they are present per case Expected activities Register Order Perform Credit Check Validate Stock Confirm Shipment Ship Goods Issue Invoice Receive Payment Query to find cases missing any of the activities WITH expected_activities AS SELECT case_id activity FROM VALUES Register Order Perform Credit Check Validate Stock Confirm Shipment Ship Goods Issue Invoice Receive Payment AS expected activity CROSS JOIN SELECT DISTINCT case_id FROM order_event_log AS cases SELECT expected.case_id expected.activity AS missing_activity FROM expected_activities expected LEFT JOIN order_event_log oel ON expected.case_id oel.case_id AND expected.activity oel.activity WHERE oel.case_id IS NULL

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Anomaly 2 Activities out of order We can assign an expected order to each activity and then compare the actual order by timestamp to the expected order We are more interested in specific deviations Shipment before confirmation activity Ship Goods occurs before Confirm Shipment Payment before invoice activity Receive Payment occurs before Issue Invoice Credit check after shipment activity Perform Credit Check occurs after Ship Goods Stock validation after shipment activity Validate Stock occurs after Ship Goods Example Find cases where Ship Goods occurs before Confirm Shipment SELECT o1.case_id FROM order_event_log o1 JOIN order_event_log o2 ON o1.case_id o2.case_id WHERE o1.activity Ship Goods AND o2.activity Confirm Shipment AND o1.timestamp o2.timestamp Similarly for payment before invoice credit check after shipment stock validation after shipment

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Anomaly 3 For order 1004 we have Confirm Shipment with additional_info shipment_scheduled N We want to check if there are other cases with similar situation Query SELECT case_id resource additional_info FROM order_event_log WHERE activity Confirm Shipment AND additional_info LIKE shipment_scheduled N Then check if after such confirmation the goods were shipped SELECT o1.case_id FROM order_event_log o1 JOIN order_event_log o2 ON o1.case_id o2.case_id WHERE o1.activity Confirm Shipment AND o1.additional_info LIKE shipment_scheduled N AND o2.activity Ship Goods AND o2.timestamp o1.timestamp

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Anomaly 4 Missing activities per order type We have order_type in the orders table We might want to see if priority orders like 1002 are more prone to skipping steps We can join the orders table to see the order_type for the cases that have missing activities or out-of-order events

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Additional investigation We might also want to check the roles and departments to see if the right resource is performing the activity Expected mapping activity expected_role expected_department Register Order Sales Executive Sales Perform Credit Check Credit Analyst Finance Validate Stock Warehouse Staff Logistics Confirm Shipment Logistics Manager Logistics Ship Goods Warehouse Staff Logistics Issue Invoice Finance NULL Receive Payment Finance NULL Query to flag activities performed by the wrong department or role WITH expected AS SELECT Register Order AS activity Sales AS expected_department Sales Executive AS expected_role UNION ALL SELECT Perform Credit Check Finance Credit Analyst UNION ALL SELECT Validate Stock Logistics Warehouse Staff UNION ALL SELECT Confirm Shipment Logistics Logistics Manager UNION ALL SELECT Ship Goods Logistics Warehouse Staff UNION ALL SELECT Issue Invoice Finance NULL UNION ALL SELECT Receive Payment Finance NULL SELECT oel.case_id oel.activity oel.resource r.department AS actual_department r.role AS actual_role expected.expected_department expected.expected_role FROM order_event_log oel JOIN resources r ON oel.resource r.resource_id JOIN expected ON oel.activity expected.activity WHERE expected.expected_department IS NOT NULL AND r.department expected.expected_department OR expected.expected_role IS NOT NULL AND r.role expected.expected_role
